description: From New Latin semelfactīvus, equivalent to Latin semel (“once, a single time”), from Proto-Indo-European *sḗm (“one, together”); plus factive, from Latin factum (“event, occurrence”), from faciō (“to do”), from Proto-Indo-European *dʰeh₁- (“to put, to do”); plus the Latin adjectival suffix -īvus.

entries.meaning: (grammar) Of or relating to the semelfactive aspect.
